creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de
text:
Apache Forrest complains about a missing favicon.ico while testing the links of
the documentation. (This might be a bug in Forrest.)

creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de
text:
Building the site with Forrest fails because of this error and another similar
error (missing "images/.jpg")

i just tried this, and it worked for me.

are you issuing

forrest

in lenya/docu?

do you have FORREST_HOME set?
creator: gregor@apache.org

text:
> are you issuing
> forrest
> in lenya/docu?

I am issuing forrest in "lenya.docu" according to
http://lenya.apache.org/community/website-update.html#Updating+the+Lenya+website

> do you have FORREST_HOME set?

Yes.

I will do more research on this problem.
creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de

text:
I think I found the origin of the problem.

I strictly followed the documentation
(http://lenya.apache.org/community/website-update.html and
http://forrest.apache.org/build.html)

I therefore downloaded Apache Forrest 0.7-dev. That probably is the wrong
version. 0.6 is the latest released version. Also the documentation of Forrest
0.6 is not compatible with 0.7-dev. At least some directories are different.
creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de
gregor@apache.org
text:
correct, you need to use forrest 0.6 

(i wish they would not break things all the time..)

i clarified that page to explitly mention 0.6

can you test with 0.6 and close out if appropriate?
creator: gregor@apache.org

text:
I tested with Forrest 0.6. The problem with the missing favicon.ico is gone -
but the build still fails.

brokenlinks.xml says:

<broken-links>
  <link message="/home/andreas/forrest/src/core/context/.../images/.jpg (No such
file or directory)">images/.jpg</link> 
</broken-links>

I noticed that Forrest 0.6 seems to use "cocoon 2.2.0-dev" ...
creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de
A.Kuckartz@ping.de
text:
Reassigned to dev@lenya.apache.org

(I currently do not want to spend more time on this problem with Forrest.)

creator: gregor@apache.org
text:
the contents of brokenlinks can be misleading. forrest creates all pages for me,
ready for upload. can you check if it does create the site for you too?

I already thought that the error message is misleading. As far as I could see
the site was created correctly.

I hate software where error messages can not be trusted. (And I did not want to
risk ruining the complete Lenya website while making some small additions :-)
creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de
gregor@apache.org
text:
don't worry: you gotta break some eggs to make omlettes.

closing this out since it is not a lenya issue. i will add a note to the site
update page about this.
